text:
the second (last) link contains some interesting info:

* PCB (process control block), which is a datastructure in the OS (not specifically Linux) that contains the process's context
* an interesting chart explaining the cost of context switching, which I should probably draw later with plantuml or dot.

So please revisit it later. 

(Once you get to do it, this might be helpful/insightful: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/150734/where-is-pcb-on-linux
)
title: Comment by '(anonymous)' on 'Context Switch'
